title.narrative: HIV TREATMENT & RETENTION

description.narrative: By 2020, HIV positive pregnant and lactating women and children better adhere to HIV treatment and related services, which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, people, particularly women and young children, more equitably access and use quality health and nutrition services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, HIV positive pregnant and lactating women and children better adhere to HIV treatment and related services

description.narrative:
In 2019, UNICEF's major contribution was at policy level to develop the five-year national strategic plan for triple elimination of vertical transmission of HIV, Syphilis and Hepatitis, including the costing. The expansion of the Point of Care /Early Infant Diagnosis platform was achieved, with 130 sites nationally. UNICEF also implemented interventions focus on High pregnancy rate (48%) and prevalence of HIV (7.2%) in Adolescent Girls and Young Women in Mozambique by building capacities of the Youth Friendly Health Clinics for comprehensive HIV service delivery.
| Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/01/2020
